context: In Estonian, 'köide' refers to a bound book or volume. It specifically means the physical binding of a book that gives it strength and form, as well as referring to a complete set of works published in multiple volumes. For example, when someone mentions 'A. H. Tammsaare "Tõde ja õigus" koosneb viiest köitest', they mean the work consists of five volumes. The word can also refer to the physical act of binding.
